title: How to Make Seafood Tagliatelle

steps.headline: Keep the water to boil Place a pan filled three quarters full of water on the hob over a high heat.
steps.description: Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil and a pinch of salt. Cover and bring to the boil.

steps.headline: Cook the seafood.
steps.description: Place the large frying pan on a high heat until very hot. Add the clams and mussels and shake. Cover for 1 minute, shaking occasionally to help open the shellfish. When they are partially open, add the wine and allow to reduce for 2 minutes, again shaking occasionally.

steps.headline: Add the prawns, cream and parsley, reserving a small amount to garnish.
steps.description: Season with salt and pepper and stir. Cover and cook for another 3 minutes, until the mussels and clams have all opened.

steps.headline: Cook and drain the pasta.
steps.description: When the water is boiling, add the pasta. Stir, leave to cook for 5 minutes and drain in the colander.

steps.headline: Combine the dish.
steps.description: Discard any of the shellfish that have not opened, then add the rest to the pasta pan, mixing well. Cover and leave to absorb the flavor for a couple of minutes.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve.
steps.description: Spoon a generous portion onto a serving place and garnish with some chopped parsley. The dish is now ready to serve.

text: Keep the water to boil Place a pan filled three quarters full of water on the hob over a high heat. Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil and a pinch of salt. Cover and bring to the boil. Cook the seafood. Place the large frying pan on a high heat until very hot. Add the clams and mussels and shake. Cover for 1 minute, shaking occasionally to help open the shellfish. When they are partially open, add the wine and allow to reduce for 2 minutes, again shaking occasionally. Add the prawns, cream and parsley, reserving a small amount to garnish. Season with salt and pepper and stir. Cover and cook for another 3 minutes, until the mussels and clams have all opened. Cook and drain the pasta. When the water is boiling, add the pasta. Stir, leave to cook for 5 minutes and drain in the colander. Combine the dish. Discard any of the shellfish that have not opened, then add the rest to the pasta pan, mixing well. Cover and leave to absorb the flavor for a couple of minutes. Garnish and serve. Spoon a generous portion onto a serving place and garnish with some chopped parsley. The dish is now ready to serve.
